title: Citibank Strikes Gold for 'Best Jobs' Campaign to Boost Tourism in Australia
summary: Sydney - Citibank Australia has been announced as the Gold award winner for its 'Best Jobs in the World' campaign at Marketing Events Magazine's 2013 Awards.
tag-1: Citibank Strikes Gold for 'Best Jobs' Campaign to Boost Tourism in Australia
tag-2: Sydney – Citibank Australia has been announced as the Gold award winner for its 'Best Jobs in the World' campaign at Marketing Events Magazine's 2013 Awards.
tag-3: Citibank, recognized in the 'Best Sponsorship Activation' category, beat several other finalists to win the award.
tag-4: The 'Best jobs' campaign was a global competition in partnership with Tourism Australia, to find six youth travellers for six-month job opportunities promoting the land down under.
tag-5: The six "Best Jobs in the World" included an Outback Adventurer in the Northern Territory, Park Ranger in Queensland, Wildlife Caretaker in South Australia, Chief Funster in New South Wales, Lifestyle Photographer in Melbourne and Taste Master in Western Australia. Each came with an attractive salary package worth A$100,000 including living costs.
tag-6: Linda Duncombe, Director of Digital, Marketing and Customer Experience for Citibank Australia, said, "We are extremely proud to have been recognized for our work on this great campaign. We pride ourselves on the global banking services we provide to travellers the world over, and I'm pleased that we've been able to help boost awareness and interest in tourism in Australia."
tag-7: The event was brought to life with the 18 finalists taking part in a series of challenges across the country to decide the six final winners.
tag-8: As the Major Partner of the Sydney Swans since 2005, Citi introduced the finalists to the exciting spectacle of the Australian Football League (AFL) at a training session held at the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG), home of the Sydney Swans. Finalists had the once in a lifetime opportunity to take a part in a hands-on training session with Swans heroes past and present led by 2005 Swans grand finalist Nick Davis, ex Swans captain Adam Goodes and current senior players Mike Pyke and Jarrod McVeigh. Finalists also experienced a coach room briefing and were presented with their own official playing Guernsey as a keepsake of the day.
tag-9: Finalists were encouraged to post and tweet via Facebook and Twitter to share their experience, which helped amplify the reach of the campaign.
tag-10: The Marketing Events Magazine Awards recognize and honor the best of Asia's event marketing, management and planning industry.
tag-11: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. In Australia, Citi serves more than 1 million consumer accounts and 900 corporate accounts with a comprehensive product offering and one of the largest global networks of any bank with operations in Australia.
